results.title: Way to new homes: a Swedish approach to the housing problem
results.brief_description: Slum abolition and housing projects in the university city of Uppsala, Sweden. Compares favourable living conditions in a modern suburb with the slums, and associated child delinquency, in othe parts of the city. Under Government and municipal housing schemes, the city is being reconstructed and individual homes and blocks of apartments built on a tenant ownership system to accommodate white collar workers, students, and labourers. Aspects of the scheme include low rentals, housing subsidies, rebates on yearly rents for each child under sixteen, well planned playgrounds, and hobby-rooms for recreation.

results.title: Wax and wool
results.creator_credit: Richard Raxlen, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: In small Mexican villages, the local residents make colourful yarn paintings by pressing wool into a mixture of bee’s wax and resin. Records the fluid convergence of yarn, wax and resin into a two-dimensional design of brilliant colour and beauty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Raxlen, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB

results.title: Waverley steps: a visit to Edinburgh
results.creator_credit: John Eldridge, Paul Fletcher and Greenpark Productions

results.title: Wave velocities, dispersion and the omega beta diagram (TEFC
results.brief_description: Theodore Van Duger of the University of California, Berkley, shows that a prediction of the action of complex waves can be determined if it is known how its sine wave components propagate along the same system. The film studies the propagation and superposition of complex waves in a barrier system.

results.title: Wave particle duality
results.brief_description: Introduces and discusses the dual nature of light and matter and traces the development of the theory of wave-particle duality. A demonstration showing beams of electrons and neutrons creating a picture of wave motion similar to light’s wave motion is also given.

results.title: Wattle ballad. No. 1. My old black billy
results.brief_description: The song of the swagman who intends to “stick to me sensible, indispensable, old black billy”, sung by male voices and illustrated by shots of the swagman’s life. Arranged and sung by The Ramblers. Cast features Jock Levy.

results.title: Waters of life
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: The advantages of the Colombo Plan to the people of Ceylon. Shows how the old way of living, with its drought, disease and lack of agriculture has been changed by the new schemes providing for controlled irrigation, clearing of land, and resettling of villages. Adapted from the Ceylon Government Film “New Horizons”.
